habitat_description:
The geographic range extends from southern South Dakota, Nebraska, southeastern Wyoming, Colorado, southeastern Utah, New Mexico, Arizona, and western Texas. In Mexico, populations have been reported in Chihuahua (Baxter and Stone 1980; Conant and Collins 1998; Hammerson 1999; Jones and Lovich 2009; Stebbins 2003). In Arizona, this species occupies the Plains and Great Basin Grassland, also the Petran Montane Conifer Forest (Brennan and Holycross 2009).

The habitats occupied by this species include desert, grassland, shrubland, chaparral, suburban, orchard, and various woodland areas. In the northern localities of its range it inhabits prairie grassland and sandhills. The southern populations are found along streamside thickets, fir forests, creosote bush desert, oak shrubland, vacant lots, dumps, and pinyon/juniper and pine/oak woodland (Conant and Collins 1998; Degenhardt et al. 1996; Hammerson 1999; Stebbins 2003). Also found in urban and suburban areas (Jones and Lovich 2009).

SW-	Desert, grassland, creosote bush, vacant lots, dumps, and pinyon/juniper woodlands.
GP-	Prairie grassland and sandhills.
